intro: Psychotria oreophila, commonly known as the cloud forest psychotria, is a species native to the humid, high-altitude regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. This plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in montane forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a glossy surface, and it produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant is notable for its ecological role in supporting various insect and bird species within its native habitat.
